intro: Meriania paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense Meriania, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to the Amazon Basin. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are often consumed by birds and mammals, aiding in seed dispersal. Meriania paraensis is often found in moist, shaded understories of tropical forests, where it thrives in humid, nutrient-rich soils.
